text:
ABOUT US Streamup is the fastest growing community for streaming interactive live shows, growing from only 1MM MAU in January 2015 to 24MM MAU today. We're a 9 person team backed by Y Combinator (W16), Mucker Capital, Bam Ventures, and SocialStarts.

HIRING For the next stage, we're looking for an experienced, full-stack engineer who can help us scale the platform to 100MM MAUs and beyond. Do you have what it takes?

REQIUREMENTS • Experience w/ Rails + Postgres + ReactJS + Node.JS • Experience scaling large consumer platforms • Leadership experience • Some dev-ops / server-side experience • Must be located in or willing to move to Los Angeles - we're based in Santa Monica • Proactive, self-managing • Good communication skills

LET'S TALK Email us at jobs@streamup.com

_______

NOTE TO RECRUITERS We do not work with recruiters under any circumstances.
title: Streamup (YC W16) Is Hiring a Senior Full-Stack Engineer in LA

text:
The lambda-calculus is amazing and rather terce. I read a lot of things here and there, written by smart people, but I am not sure that I understand what is to be understood. So, using a small lispy dialect I am working on, lambdatalk, I decided to translate some primitive objects of lambda-calculus - Church numbers, a set of operators (succ, add, mul, power), pairs, computing factorial - and I wrote this page [lambda_calculus](http://epsilonwiki.free.fr/lambdaway/?view=lambda_calculus). It's a work in progress. I feel I understand a little more the lambda-calculus :)

I wonder what smart people like you could think of this work. Your opinion is welcome. Thanks in advance.
title: Lambda-calculus in lambdatalk

Elixir RAM and the Template of Doom

text:
I just got this email from GitLab:

--------------------

We have discovered a critical security issue in all GitLab CE and EE versions from 8.2 to 8.7.

On Monday May 2, 2016 at 4:59pm PDT (23:59 GMT), we will publish new GitLab patch releases for all affected versions. We strongly recommend that all installations running a version mentioned above be upgraded as soon as possible after the release. Please forward this alert to the appropriate person at your organization and have them subscribe to Security Notices

The following versions are affected:

8.7.0 8.6.0 through 8.6.7 8.5.0 through 8.5.11 8.4.0 through 8.4.9 8.3.0 through 8.3.8 8.2.0 through 8.2.4
title: GitLab Security Vunerability
